data.title: Audio Guide on Portuguese Tiles in Lisbon
data.meta_description: Join an expert-led audio guide on a self-paced tour of Lisbon's unique and mysterious  tiles, or azulejos in Portuguese, and the many influences behind them. You'll learn how azulejos arrived in Portugal and how their decorative and practical uses changed the architecture of Portugal forever. Perfect for anyone interested in discovering how Portuguese tiles became a significant part of Portugal's colorful history.
data.meta_site_name:
Audio Guide on Portuguese Tiles in Lisbon | Context Travel
 - Context Travel
data.text: Bert is an Architect and Writer and holds a Master's Degree in Architectural Engineering and Cultural Sciences. He was born in Belgium and has lived and worked in Amsterdam, Beijing, and Shanghai before relocating to Lisbon in 2018. He established his career through many academic and writing-focused roles throughout his journey – also working as an Architectural consultant. He is the co-director of "MovingCities," an independent research organization investigating the role that architecture and urbanism play in shaping the contemporary city of Lisbon. Bert lived in China from 2006 to 2018, where he first began leading Context walks. He also has a great understanding of Lisbon’s historic legacy, Jewish culture, and architectural style – fields of interest he has studied relentlessly since his first visit to the city in 2003.
